title: Keen Dreams 3D
content:
Well, the game's in the mail, and it's on its way to Vitamin Zach. Hope you guys like it once it gets onto the Internet, but I should warn you of a couple of minor problems with the game, resulting from my inexperience in scripting (but these problems are not unavoidable, however):
1) There's a glitch with the elevators that if Keen walks off of them while they're still moving, he'll float in mid-air however high the elevator is. I have no idea how to fix this problem, but some simple ways to avoid this glitch are to always get on the elevators slowly, wait until they come to a complete stop before getting off, and if Keen starts to "glide" while they're moving, move him backwards until he's stopped.
2) The save system built into the 3D Game Studio engine is faulty in the area of music - that is, the music playing before you load your file will continue to play after you load it, instead of changing to the music of the level that your saved game is on. Again, I have no idea how to fix this, mainly because I know next to nothing about how this save system works. The way I got around this problem while playing was that I always saved my game on the map screen, so that the music would change anyway once I entered a level.

Other than these two problems, I'm pretty satisfied and happy with the end result (and yes, I have completed the entire game in one sitting several times). Just hope you guys like it! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]
In the meantime, here are some screenshots of the finished game while you wait...
[url=http://imageshack.us][img]http://img480.imageshack.us/img480/4227/kd3dnewshot12ei.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: Keen Dreams 3D
content:
This does not suck. I just downloaded this and it seems like a pretty well made game. Sure the controlls are clunky but a key mapper would take care of that. Definitely NOT a CK2000.

Although there are some MAJOR issues with it. First off is that you can jump on the world map. This lets you completely jump over levels.

Also is if you are running and you jump it has the half life thing where you go FASTER for some reason. (At least it seemed that way.)

And the third thing I found was "Wall jumping." If you hold down the jump button Commander Keen will continuously jump. Well this isn't that bad but there are some bad parts on the levels (Especially on the invisible walls) where Commander Keen will snag onto a vertex or something and continuously jump, rocketing him into the air. This is especially weird when you fly so high you land on top of an invisible wall and you REALLY fly off into the air.

I also got trapped in places where you aren't supposed to be able to go using this bug. Now this isn't TOO BAD of a problem because you can always get back to where you ARE supposed to be.

Please note that this was almost all done on the world map and from only 10 minutes or so of testing. I am sure that this would all be solved if you disable jumping on the world map.

Anyway. It is still a really awesome effort. Especially from only one person. Seriously I couldn't do something like this even if I would want to try.-----------------------

title: Re: Keen Dreams 3D
content:
Problems with the game I noticed:

-You picked probably the most counter-intuitive controls ever. I mean, having to press the Home key to jump? What on earth were you thinking? It's complicated enough with the fact that Keen's jumps are ridiculously high.

-Keen's jumps are ridiculously high. In a platformer game where jumping is important, a flaw such as this can't really just slip under the radar. The jumping makes it just impossible to guess where he's going to land, especially considering the layout of the game.

-The layout of the game is horrible. It seems like you sacrificed gameplay merely to stay true to the original. Each level is dreadfully linear for a 3d game. It just makes me wonder 'Why is this even 3D?'. Maybe if at the very least it was from a side-view perspective it would be forgivable, but the behind view makes it impossible to judge where you're going to land. It's all just ridiculous.

There's a plethora of glitches. From the camera bug to the platform bug. Plus Keen's walk cycle looks ridiculous, and all of the scenery is incredibly dull. Even if keeping the polygon count is an issue, it's possible to find creative ways of making things look decent. That is not really evident here.[center]TOUGH GUYS DON'T FOLLOW FADS[/center]

title: Re: Keen Dreams 3D
content:
I must say, this game wasn't too good. Here's some suggestions.

- Keen's walking animation was WAY too fast. His walking speed is ok, but the animation displaying him walking just is too fast.

- Collision is not too good. Slopes are hard to walk on and he automatically falls down from it when you're standing on a slope.

- Levels could have been made wider, because now it just plays
like the 2D thing, because you STILL only can go forward...

- Use the original Keen controls. ctrl, alt, space. If alt doesn't work correctly, use the Z key instead or something. Making keys configurable would be nice too (and maybe gamepad support?).

- When defeating an enemy, he shrinks and dies. What happened to the enemy turning into a flower, or, as in the later games, being stunned with stars above his head? Ah well.

- It's hard to jump on platforms, because of the too-fast jumping speed.

- Some moving platforms stop moving after Keen jumps on them for the second+ time.

- The intro screen kinda looked bad. Probably because of the bad mix between 2D and 3D. I'm willing to make a new title screen if you want me to (using the 3D modeling program Blender), which has both the waking up Keen picture and some better fitting 3D text...

That's it for now.___________________
DaVince, Yet Another Amateur Game Creator! :P

title: well
content:
Well, I have to admit, this has a lot more potential than the other posters give it. We need a different camera system--something much more 3rd person, on rails, with fixed waypoints, and so on. We need better animations, and we need changed menu sound effects.

I think the biggest thing that deters me from playing this more is the campy animation style. It just looks undeveloped. What sort of tools are you using to animate this? This looks rather fun to develop for, honestly...

title: Re: well
content: well i just played the game, and i think the posters that shot you in the face about this game just put themselves on their own high pedistal. Yes the game does need improvement, a lot that is. Maybe you should have posted it as a beta and not a final release. Even though the game is linear, i found it to be quite a nice change from the 2d predicessor. A lot of people have said in the past they would rather keep the keen fan games in the 2d era where it blongs, and i kind of feel the same way for it would be sort of weird to see the massive change.  At least it stayed sort of true to the original. I would say dont make this the final release but just a beta. If you can figure out the bugs in your code, such as movement, camera angles, etc, i think this game will be very fun.

title: Well Done, Sire. Again.
content:
Yay, I don't need to rewrite my post. CM pretty much paraphrased it for me.

One other complaint: the Carrot Courier cannot climb slopes. It should be running and jumping all over the place.

Incredible atmosphere--the scenery is just mindblowing, despite its simplicity. I could easily just wander around exploring the place if there were no hazards. Unfortunately, the physics, limited AI, controls and that whole shooting thing are too offputting.

Since I first played the game, however, Xky has pointed out that the number pad is how it's meant to be played, so I'll give it another shot yet with that in mind. I still strongly suggest changing the controls though.

If you have time to fix the criticisms we've pointed out and create another release, this game will pwn.

Well done on the first ever 3D Keen game. Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

A concerned member of the Preservation of Endangered Spleens Society

title: thing.
content:
Allstories, why don't you make your own- oh, wait. I won't say that. Djaser's posted here enough already.


I remember the old days of the PCKF when a person would be congratulated for cranking up KMO and simply finishing the task of making a new level for Keen 1.

This thread makes me wonder: where the hell have those days gone?

If this game were released back then, would we still be complaining about not being able to use the control keys that we would have liked and complaining that the level layouts aren't what we wanted? (I know that some people pointed these things out in their posts as suggestions for improvement - I'm not talking about those people here).

Maybe we'd appriciate the game more for what it is - the first 3D Keen game ever. Not what it isn't.

Perhaps some of us would be more grateful that a Keen fan has released his years-in-the-making project for us to play, instead of just saying outright that it sucks and even critizing the game (or was it the game's creator?) BEFORE it was even released. I'm talking about you, Allstories.


I'm not going to tell Allstories to go make his own game, because like Djaser was possibly trying to say (and if not, I'd hope his 'shut the fuck up' posts actually have some point to them for the language used), you don't need to be able to make your own game to notice improvements that could be made to others' games. (Instead of crying 'ignorants!' he could have explained that in his posts...)

Perhaps instead Allstories can go learn what's involved in making a game like this - not so he can make a game of perfection, but so he can understand why some of these so-called bugs and glitches are in the game, and how it's not just a matter of "Well, Allstories thought 'the layout of the game is horrible'. There. All fixed." or "Allstories thinks the game looks like some shoddy Gamemaker game. I'll just change this and this. There! A commercial quality game!"

That would enable him, instead of just saying it sucks, to explain why it sucks and provide a practical way to improve it.

edit: changed a few words around.--------------
[url=http://spikenexus.toxicsheep.com/pccw/][img]http://spikenexus.toxicsheep.com/pccw/imgs/links/pccwsml.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: thing.
content:
Indeed. It seems there's a lot of cynicism floating around in response to some Keen projects these days. We've already got too many projects getting cancelled because their perceived as 'worthless' without people intentionally shooting down magnificent accomplishments of this magnitude.

In responsse to the 'stfu, ignorant mofo!' comment, let me offer an alternative, more appropriate phrase:

You can't judge anything if you can't do better. Two thirds of allstories' posts were raw judgement. One was useful criticism, which is useful (although they were written in a similarly tactless manner).

Good to see the majority of people are showing some gratitude. Such is what makes this community work. Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

A concerned member of the Preservation of Endangered Spleens Society

title: Re: thing.
content:
Good point about the atmosphere, Spleen. I think the game frustrated me a little too much and made me forget all about it. I really liked the background elements, but I was mad that I couldn't go check them out up close. What I'd like to see are, first, strafe keys that are somewhere near my control key (my laptop has no right control key), and some new levels that take advantage of their third dimension. Nothing makes me madder than an invisible wall. I don't know if you've got any plans for another version, but if you do, those two things would make me really happy. I guess your internet connection prevents any frequent changes, even if you want to make them.________________
[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v462/lemur821/toughyorp.png[/img]

title: Re: thing.
content:
I don't mind someone having an oppinion and all, but sometimes you gotta have alittle respect for the person who actually went through the trouble of making a 3d game for us, the PCKF community.

I think DJaser needs to relax, and secondly i have no idea what he's even arguing about in the first place.

I on the other hand am not sorry because i feel that what i said had to be said. I don't think what Allstories said is anything to start an argument over.

If djaser wants to tell every one to shut up just because someone is disagreeing with another persons opinion when trying to actually sound nice to the person who went through the trouble of creating this game in the first place, then maybe he shouldnt even be posting on forums. I wonder how many of those 4,500 posts are of any significance.

Once again, this is a good game. Sure the controlls are a bit funny, but its a start and im looking foward to the next version.

content:

The controls are wierd but if you use the numpad for most of the keys you can get used to it.

Anyway, I like the gameplay alot (its really differnt with the shooting potatoes and stuff) and I'm glad he made this game instead of just another mod like all the others.
Its a good game!

title: Re: thing.
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]What the hell is your problem DJaser, if anyone here is ignorant its you. Im clearly defending thenewmoonsidianX. Why dont you say somthing for a change that dosnt result in being rude to everyone.[hr][/quote]
I have a lot problem but in this topic you are. First of all you post an invalid argument just to silence a discussion and now you're calling me a DJ.
I'll stop being rude to you when you deserve it.

[quote]Quote:[hr]Its quite clear DJ has no idea what the word 'criticise' means, so he can stfu cause i dont give a sh#% what he has to say. [hr][/quote]
Unfortunately your comment clearly shows you do, but you almost got me fooled there.

[quote]Quote:[hr]If djaser wants to tell every one to shut up just because someone is disagreeing with another persons opinion when trying to actually sound nice to the person who went through the trouble of creating this game in the first place, then maybe he shouldnt even be posting on forums. I wonder how many of those 4,500 posts are of any significance.[hr][/quote]
Alex please stop crying like a baby and don't take my post so personal, I almost begin to feel sorry for you.

[quote]Quote:[hr]I sincerely apologize for my comment. I was wrong and stupid. [hr][/quote]
All right, all right, I'll forgive you.

No matter how rude my post was, the message still seems to be clear to everyone.
--------------------------------------------------------
Now that is settled I want to say that this game certainly does earn a lot of respect. It looks better then I expected, it runs really smooth, the levels are nice.
But the bugs make it unplayable and that is such a waste. newmoonsidianx sould consider putting some extra hours in it and release a fixed version.

Years ago fangames and all Keen made stuff were all new to use and we thought it was fantastic. Now we look with different eyes on those things and we expect more to be pleased.
TMST made a post about that covers up some of our feeling, I'm sure you remembered it Spleen.
[quote]Quote:[hr]It's not that the community is drying up, it's just that the chances are likely that when you joined the PCKF, it was because you saw something great happening here that you liked. (Maybe you saw somebody's Keen cartoon, or heard an MP3 of a Commander Keen remix, or played a customised version of Keen1 with new graphics, and followed a nearby link to this forum so that you could share your thoughts on what you'd just seen/heard with other people.)
At the time, you would have thought "Wow! This place is HAPPENIN'!", not realising that before you arrived it was never this happenin', and it was just that little burst in productivity that attracted you in the first place. So when things naturally started to wind down to their normal pace, you feel as though it's dying - but it's not. It just means that it's now your turn to make something happen.[hr][/quote]

One last thing; what is a mofo?-----------------
[img]http://www.geocities.com/anthalerero/pic/banner_eurovision.jpg[/img]

title: Re: thing.
content:
Mofo is a "motherf*cker". [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-rolleyes.gif[/img]

Anyways, I'm glad everyone has calmed down now. (I think.) This game is really a new milestone in Keen culture -- it's the first 3D Keen fan game ever made, and I'm hoping to see more. As said by others already, it's more important that the game is made and effort put to it instead of how much it is like a commercial 3D platformer made by group of 100 people..

I'll unite to the hooray for newmoonsidianx, and hope that certain quite harsh posts didn't make him leave..3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Keen Dreams 3D
content:
This is an extremely ambitious project that has come together quite well, in my humble opinion.

And I still cannot get beyond the fact that only one person made this.

And as with all fangames, everyone looks to find all the negatives about a project.

Could you go out and buy 3D game maker and whip up a project such as this all by yourself?

I can honestly say, no.

I have 3D Game Maker, although probably an older version (3D maps, 2D sprites - very similar to Doom), and I still can't figure out how to work with it!

Yeah, it has its bugs, and controls are a bit meh...

but is there a way to remap them? If so, it's no problem then.

Instead of the arrow keys for movement, since this is a 3D game using the mouse for looking...

W for forward, A and D for strafing left and right, and S for moving backwards.

E for jump, C for crouch. Mouse button 1 for shoot, Spacebar for use. Shift for run.

Heck, one thing I am really happy about is that it actually WORKS. It doesn't crash.

Soldier of Fortune crashes my computer.

This doesn't.

w00tness
A lesson in Ascillan:

In the Dawn of a new age
"Hu beikacho-yon xa beidhakyo-yut."

In an eternal quest for world peace.
"Hu ebe'et sayboo'lin-yut yyk choo'i-yon."

Will you be my friend?
"Chi choo'zilli xa ut kle?"

title: Re: Keen Dreams 3D
content:
Actually... If I took a bit of effort getting to know any 3D game creation system, I could probably whip up a 3D game too.

What bothers me about this game is not the graphics and the idea, those look good, but it's the controls and the overall stability of the engine. I mean, the collision detection is pretty bad, things are hard to look at when you jump, platforms work once or else are broken, you can get stuck in places a lot, the level design isn't too good so you have to search around a lot etcetera.

A good, bugless engine and map design are needed to make a good game too, and this game is lacking exactly those.____________
Don't think of me as an ordinary man.

Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]
